param.type: template< typename TreeMetricType, typename TreeStatType, typename TreeMatType > class

briefdescription.para: Size of the initial sample for Monte Carlo approximations.
Coefficient to control what fraction of the amount of node's descendants is the limit before Monte Carlo estimation recurses.
Coefficient to control how much larger does the amount of node descendants has to be compared to the initial sample size in order to be a candidate for Monte Carlo estimations.

detaileddescription.para: If the evaluation results in a non-natural number, then the floor function will be applied.

briefdescription.para: Probability of error being bounded by relError when Monte Carlo is used.
If true Monte Carlo approximations will be used when possible.
If true, the KDE object is responsible for deleting the reference tree.
If true, the KDE object is trained.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double relError=KDEDefaultParams::relError, const double absError=KDEDefaultParams::absError, KernelType kernel=KernelType(), const KDEMode mode=KDEDefaultParams::mode, MetricType metric=MetricType(), const bool monteCarlo=KDEDefaultParams::monteCarlo, const double mcProb=KDEDefaultParams::mcProb, const size_t initialSampleSize=KDEDefaultParams::initialSampleSize, const double mcEntryCoef=KDEDefaultParams::mcEntryCoef, const double mcBreakCoef=KDEDefaultParams::mcBreakCoef)
memberdef.name: KDE

briefdescription.para: Initialize KDE object using custom instantiated Metric and Kernel objects.

parameterdescription.para: Relative error tolerance of the model.
Absolute error tolerance of the model.
Instantiated kernel object.
Mode for the algorithm.
Instantiated metric object.
Whether to use Monte Carlo estimations when possible.
Probability of a Monte Carlo estimation to be bounded by relative error tolerance.
Initial sample size for Monte Carlo estimations.
Coefficient to control how much larger does the amount of node descendants has to be compared to the initial sample size in order for it to be a candidate for Monte Carlo estimations.
Coefficient to control what fraction of the node's descendants evaluated is the limit before Monte Carlo estimation recurses.

briefdescription.para: Construct KDE object as a copy of the given model.

parameterdescription.para: KDE object to copy.

briefdescription.para: Construct KDE object taking ownership of the given model.

parameterdescription.para: KDE object to take ownership of.

detaileddescription.para: If this object created any trees, they will be deleted. If you created the trees then you have to delete them yourself.

briefdescription.para: Estimate density of each point in the reference set given the data of the reference set.

detaileddescription.para: It does not compute the estimation of a point with itself. The result is stored in an estimations vector. Estimations might not be normalized.

simplesect.para: The model has to be previously trained.

parameterdescription.para: Object which will hold the density of each reference point.

briefdescription.para: Estimate density of each point in the query set given the data of the reference set.

detaileddescription.para: The result is stored in an estimations vector. Estimations might not be normalized.

listitem.para: Dimension of each point in the query set must match the dimension of each point in the reference set.
Use std::move if the query set is no longer needed.

simplesect.para: The model has to be previously trained.

parameterdescription.para: Set of query points to get the density of.
Object which will hold the density of each query point.

briefdescription.para: Estimate density of each point in the query set given the data of an already created query tree.

detaileddescription.para: The result is stored in an estimations vector. Estimations might not be normalized.

listitem.para: Dimension of each point in the queryTree dataset must match the dimension of each point in the reference set.
Use std::move if the query tree is no longer needed.

simplesect.para: The model has to be previously trained and mode has to be dual-tree.

parameterdescription.para: Tree of query points to get the density of.
Mappings of query points to the tree dataset.
Object which will hold the density of each query point.

briefdescription.para: Check whether KDE model is trained or not.
Modify Monte Carlo break coefficient. (0 < newCoef <= 1).
Modify Monte Carlo initial sample size.
Get Monte Carlo initial sample size.
Get Monte Carlo probability of error being bounded by relative error.
Modify Monte Carlo probability of error being bounded by relative error.
Modify whether Monte Carlo estimations are being used or not.
Get whether Monte Carlo estimations are being used or not.

parameterdescription.para: KDE model to copy.
KDE model to copy.

briefdescription.para: Check whether reference tree is owned by the KDE model.

detaileddescription.para: It builds a tree using a reference set.
Use std::move if the reference set is no longer needed.

parameterdescription.para: Set of reference data.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the reference tree to an already created tree.

listitem.para: If TreeTraits<TreeType>::RearrangesDataset is false then it is possible to use an empty oldFromNewReferences vector.

parameterdescription.para: Built reference tree.
Permutations of reference points obtained during tree generation.

briefdescription.para: Check whether absolute and relative error values are compatible.
The KDE class is a template class for performing Kernel Density Estimations.

detaileddescription.para: In statistics, kernel density estimation is a way to estimate the probability density function of a variable in a non parametric way. This implementation performs this estimation using a tree-independent dual-tree algorithm. Details about this algorithm are available in KDERules.

parameterdescription.para: Kernel function to use for KDE calculations.
Metric to use for KDE calculations.
Type of data to use.
Type of tree to use; must satisfy the TreeType policy API.
Type of dual-tree traversal to use.
Type of single-tree traversal to use.

node.label: KDE< KernelType, MetricType, MatType, TreeType, DualTreeTraversalType, SingleTreeTraversalType >
